channel.title: This has me stumped beyond belief, I need help with a connecting issue?
channel.description:
I'm having trouble connecting to my own server, I set the gui.java serverip from localhost to "despairscape.servegame.com" and when I load up the client with no ip duc running in the background and the source running it says error connecting to server. When I go to Runelocus status checker it says my server is online and then when I go to see if I port forwarded correctly, apparently I did because I get this message from http://www.canyouseeme.org/
Success: I can see your service on *.*.*.23 on port (43594) Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
What am I forgetting to do?

item.title: This has me stumped beyond belief, I need help with a connecting issue?
item.dc:creator: @baal887 baal887
item.description:
@baal887 wrote:

ok u need to client files 1 witch is ur no-ip duc (for other ppl to use and connect) and a second client folder were the ip is set to 127.0.0.1 (so u can connect) reson for this is u are the local host and have to connect useing the local host ip rep plz if this helped

Read full topic
item.source: This has me stumped beyond belief, I need help with a connecting issue?

item.title: This has me stumped beyond belief, I need help with a connecting issue?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

I’m having trouble connecting to my own server, I set the gui.java serverip from localhost to “despairscape.servegame.com” and when I load up the client with no ip duc running in the background and the source running it says error connecting to server. When I go to Runelocus status checker it says my server is online and then when I go to see if I port forwarded correctly, apparently I did because I get this message from http://www.canyouseeme.org/

Success: I can see your service on ..*.23 on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

What am I forgetting to do?
